snippet: Sears Holdings increased sales, but digital shopping trends still pose a threat; Gap Inc.’s fourth-quarter profits increased by 61 percent.
abstract: Sears Holdings reports fourth-quarter loss of $489 million, or $4.61 a share, up from loss of $2.4 billion, or $22.47 a share, in same period year earlier; cites reduction of inventory and expenses and slight rise in sales.
lead_paragraph: Sears Holdings increased sales, but digital shopping trends still pose a threat; Gap Inc.’s fourth-quarter profits increased by 61 percent.

headline.seo: Sears Reduces Losses, and Gap Has Banner Quarter
headline.main: Sears Slows, but Does Not Reverse, Its 6-Year Descent
headline.print_headline: Sears Slows, but Does Not Reverse, Its 6-Year Descent
